intro: Viola reichenbachiana var. punctata, commonly known as the spotted violet, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central America. It features heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture and dark green coloration, often marked with distinctive purple or brown spots. The plant produces clusters of fragrant, five-petaled flowers in shades of violet or purple, typically blooming in spring. It thrives in cool, moist environments and prefers partial to full shade. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and woodland plantings.
